## Steps to Push to GitHub

### 1. Create GitHub Repository
- Go to https://github.com
- Click "+" â†’ "New repository"
- Name: `01-pakistan-ecommerce-price-prediction`
- Description: `E-commerce unit price prediction using Random Forest Regression with 92% accuracy. Production-ready Flask web app.`
- Choose **Public** (for portfolio visibility)
- **DO NOT** initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
- Click "Create repository"

### 2. Connect and Push
```bash
cd /home/ibadat/data-science-portfolio/projects/01-pakistan-ecommerce-price-prediction

# Add remote (replace YOUR_USERNAME)
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/01-pakistan-ecommerce-price-prediction.git

# Push to GitHub
git push -u origin main
```

### 3. Add Topics (SEO Optimization)
After pushing, add these topics in repository settings:
- python
- machine-learning
- regression
- random-forest
- scikit-learn
- flask
- e-commerce
- price-prediction
- data-science
- predictive-modeling
- pakistan-ecommerce
- unit-price-prediction
- web-application
- feature-engineering
- model-deployment
